_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four ascetics [an4.241:6.3]: The first ascetic - a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening
The second ascetic - a once-returner, who comes back to this world once only, then makes an end of suffering
The third ascetic - reborn spontaneously, extinguished there, and not liable to return from that world
The fourth ascetic - realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, having ended defilements
